title.rendered: We’ve been shortlisted for The Drum Recommends Awards 2020!

content.rendered:
It’s been a strange few weeks here at Harrison Carloss HQ (and by that we mean our respective homes), so it was really welcomed when we got the incredibly exciting news that we had been shortlisted for The Drum Recommends Awards 2020.

Unlike other awards, The Drum Recommends is based solely on reviews from our lovely, real-life clients, so this really means a lot to us!

 

What is The Drum?

The Drum is Europe’s largest media and marketing website, attracting over 1.4 million unique users and over 200,00 social followers each month. They pride themselves on helping businesses make informed decisions about their marketing and showcasing the best of the best.

The Drum Recommends Awards is a highlight for a number of agencies. Differing from other awards, they are based entirely on the ratings and reviews of an agency’s clients which are collected on The Drum’s Recommended Agencies website – no entries to submit or papers to write!

The award covers a number of discipline and service categories – we have been nominated for our vibrant and powerful print! We have worked on a number of exciting print projects over the last year that have really allowed us to test our creative muscles. From design to distribution, Harrison Carloss have always been at the forefront of print, so to get this recognition means so much to the team. Who said print is dead? Not us!

 

Party in our PJs!

We’re incredibly proud of the whole team, as well as the amazing clients we’ve worked with who have allowed us to showcase our talents, and have a lot of fun doing it! The winners will be announced at the end of April – without the opportunity for Harrison Carloss outing, unfortunately! Nonetheless, we are excited to find out whether we have an excuse to crack open the fancy isolation drinks we’ve been saving.

For more information about our award nominated work, get in touch with the team and see how we can help your business. Or sign up to our newsletter, The Carloss Chronicle, for the latest news, insights and more from the team.
